pullRequest.body:
Define Profinite Groups
Co-authored-by: Jujian Zhang <jujian.zhang1998@outlook.com> Nailin Guan <3571819596@qq.com>

---
<!-- The text above the `---` will become the commit message when your
PR is merged. Please leave a blank newline before the `---`, otherwise
GitHub will format the text above it as a title.

For details on the "pull request lifecycle" in mathlib, please see:
https://leanprover-community.github.io/contribute/index.html

In particular, note that most reviewers will only notice your PR
if it passes the continuous integration checks.
Please ask for help on https://leanprover.zulipchat.com if needed.

To indicate co-authors, include lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Co-authored-by: Author Name <author@email.com>

If you are moving or deleting declarations, please include these lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Moves:
- Vector.* -> Mathlib.Vector.*
- ...

Deletions:
- Nat.bit1_add_bit1
- ...

Any other comments you want to keep out of the PR commit should go
below the `---`, and placed outside this HTML comment, or else they
will be invisible to reviewers.

If this PR depends on other PRs, please list them below this comment,
using the following format:
- [ ] depends on: #abc [optional extra text]
- [ ] depends on: #xyz [optional extra text]

-->

nodes.body:
### PR summary [1f7edcd38e](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/pull/16648/commits/1f7edcd38e3f8a69597766a20ef30593a53942d0)

#### Import changes for modified files

No significant changes to the import graph


<details><summary>Import changes for all files</summary>

|Files|Import difference|
|-|-|
| `Mathlib.Algebra.Category.Grp.FiniteGrp`|461|
| `Mathlib.Topology.Algebra.Category.ProfiniteGrp`|1359|

</details>

---

<details><summary>

#### Declarations diff

</summary>

`+ FiniteAddGrp`
`+ FiniteGrp`
`+ ProfiniteAddGrp`
`+ ProfiniteGrp`
`+ coe_comp`
`+ coe_id`
`+ coe_of`
`+ instance (G : FiniteGrp) : Finite G := G.isFinite`
`+ instance (G : FiniteGrp) : Group G := inferInstanceAs <| Group G.toGrp`
`+ instance (G H : FiniteGrp) : FunLike (G âŸ¶ H) G H`
`+ instance (G H : FiniteGrp) : MonoidHomClass (G âŸ¶ H) G H`
`+ instance (G H : ProfiniteGrp) : ContinuousMapClass (G âŸ¶ H) G H`
`+ instance (G H : ProfiniteGrp) : FunLike (G âŸ¶ H) G H`
`+ instance (G H : ProfiniteGrp) : MonoidHomClass (G âŸ¶ H) G H`
`+ instance : Category FiniteGrp := InducedCategory.category FiniteGrp.toGrp`
`+ instance : Category ProfiniteGrp`
`+ instance : CoeSort FiniteGrp.{u} (Type u)`
`+ instance : CoeSort ProfiniteGrp (Type u)`
`+ instance : ConcreteCategory FiniteGrp := InducedCategory.concreteCategory FiniteGrp.toGrp`
`+ instance : ConcreteCategory ProfiniteGrp`
`+ instance : HasForgetâ‚‚ FiniteGrp ProfiniteGrp`
`+ instance : HasForgetâ‚‚ ProfiniteGrp Grp`
`+ ofFiniteGrp`
`+ ofHom`
`+ ofHom_apply`
`+ ofProfinite`
`++ of`
`++ pi`
<details>
  <summary>You can run this locally as follows</summary>


```bash
## summary with just the declaration names:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh <optional_commit>

## more verbose report:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh long <optional_commit>
```
</details>

The doc-module for `script/declarations_diff.sh` contains some details about this script.

</details>

@Thmoas-Guan could you go through all the unresolved comments here, and whenever you feel that you've addressed a comment in such a way that it doesn't need further discussion, click on "resolve conversation". Then when the PR is ready for review again, you can remove the `awaiting-author` label and I'll take another look
Oh, i forgot to look at the file about finite groups. Could you also try to make similar modifications there to the ones I've suggested for profinite groups?

Thanks!

maintainer merge
ðŸš€ Pull request has been placed on the maintainer queue by dagurtomas.
bors d=faenuccio

:v: faenuccio can now approve this pull request. To approve and merge a pull request, simply reply with `bors r+`. More detailed instructions are available [here](https://bors.tech/documentation/getting-started/#reviewing-pull-requests).
bors r+

Pull request successfully merged into master.

Build succeeded:
  * [Build](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/10906611012/job/30268256571)
  * [Lint style](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/10906611012/job/30268256197)

All the stuff related to `FiniteGrp`Â should go in a new file in a new directory `Algebra.Category.FiniteGrp`. The stuff about `ProfiniteGrp` should either go in a new directory `Topology.Category.ProfiniteGrp` or `Topology.Algebra.Category.ProfiniteGrp`.
I agree with both of @jjaassoonn's comments
Almost ready to go, just some comments about docstrings.
Can you fix the formatting of the docstrings in the file about finite groups (add spaces after and before the `/--`Â and `-/`). Also some docstrings need to be modified for finite additive groups.
Nice work!
I left some comments, but it is basically ok. Thanks!

```suggestion
def ofProfinite (G : Profinite) [Group G] [TopologicalGroup G] : ProfiniteGrp := of G

```
Maybe this should even be an `abbrev`.
Maybe you should add `coe_of`, `coe_id`, `coe_comp`Â simp lemmas. See the file `Topology.Category.CompHausLike.Basic` for a template.

```suggestion
        intro G H f g h
        exact DFunLike.ext _ _ <| fun x => congr_fun h x }
```

```suggestion
    map := fun f => f }
  forget_faithful :=
```

```suggestion
instance : HasForgetâ‚‚ FiniteGrp ProfiniteGrp where
  forgetâ‚‚ :=
```
I'm not very familiar with the algebraic hierarchy in Mathlib but, why not just use `[Group G] [Finite G]`? Also, is it intentional that there's no actual requirement `[Group toGrp]`?

> I'm not very familiar with the algebraic hierarchy in Mathlib but, why not just use `[Group G] [Finite G]`? Also, is it intentional that there's no actual requirement `[Group toGrp]`?

This defines the category of finite groups. Maybe the annotation here should be revised to be clearer, following the example of the annotation in `Grp`.

> I'm not very familiar with the algebraic hierarchy in Mathlib but, why not just use `[Group G] [Finite G]`? Also, is it intentional that there's no actual requirement `[Group toGrp]`?

Do you mean that changing the definition to the following would be better?
````lean
@[pp_with_univ]
structure FiniteGrp where
  G : Type u
  [isGroup : Group G]
  [isFinite : Finite G]
I think it is the doc string problem, it should be changed to `The category of finite groups`

> I'm not very familiar with the algebraic hierarchy in Mathlib but, why not just use `[Group G] [Finite G]`? Also, is it intentional that there's no actual requirement `[Group toGrp]`?

This is to make `InducedCategory.category FiniteGrp.toGrp` possible.

```suggestion
/-- The structure of finite groups -/
```

```suggestion
```

```suggestion
/--
The category of profinite groups. A term of this type consists of a profinite 
set with a topological group structure.
-/
```

```suggestion
  /-- The underlying profinite set. -/
```

```suggestion
  /-- The group structure. -/
  [group : Group toProfinite]
  /-- The above data together form a topological group. -/
  [topologicalGroup : TopologicalGroup toProfinite]
```

the naming is a bit weird, its full name is now `ProfiniteGrp.Pi.profiniteGrp`, may be just `ProfiniteGrp.Pi`?
```lean
def pi {Î± : Type u} (Î² : Î± â†’ ProfiniteGrp) : ProfiniteGrp := ...
```
Is it helpful to have other `HasForgetâ‚‚` instances, such as to `Profinite`, to `Grp`
I agree that the functors from `ProfiniteGrp` to `Profinite` and `Grp` should be added.
added, also is there the category of topological group?
added, also is there the category of topological group?
I don't think so, but you could add it in a separate PR
maybe I can work on it later
Should we have an additive version, by which I mean `ProfiniteAddGrp` and `FiniteAddGrp` etc?
~~Maybe `to_additive` will work?~~, `to_additive` does not work
This is a good point. What about defining the structure `ProfiniteAddGrp` and then after that's defined, `attribute [to_additive] ProfiniteGrp`?
added
Is the `v` here actually used?
you are right, it is once a bigger file and I forgot to delete it when spliting, thank you
Maybe here the name should just be `Profinite.pi`
If you are sure it is better then I will change them (two Pi), because I am not enough familiar with the naming convention.

```suggestion
attribute [instance] group topologicalGroup ProfiniteAddGrp.addGroup ProfiniteAddGrp.topologicalAddGroup
```
(there might be some trick to add the additive instances without declaring them explicitly this way)
sorry that I don't know the trick currently, so I just use what you suggested

```suggestion
/--
The category of profinite additive groups. A term of this type consists of a profinite
set with a topological additive group structure.
-/
@[pp_with_univ]
structure ProfiniteAddGrp where
  /-- The underlying profinite topological space. -/
  toProfinite : Profinite
  /-- The additive group structure. -/
  [addGroup : AddGroup toProfinite]
  /-- The above data together form a topological additive group. -/
```

```suggestion
/--
Construct a term of `ProfiniteGrp` from a type endowed with the structure of a
compact, Hausdorff and totally disconnected topological group.
-/
@[to_additive]
def of (G : Type u) [Group G] [TopologicalSpace G] [TopologicalGroup G]
    [CompactSpace G] [TotallyDisconnectedSpace G] : ProfiniteGrp where
  toProfinite := .of G
  group := â€¹_â€º
  topologicalGroup := â€¹_â€º

/--
Construct a term of `ProfiniteAddGrp` from a type endowed with the structure of a
compact, Hausdorff and totally disconnected topological additive group.
-/
add_decl_doc ProfiniteAddGrp.of
```

Please make similar modifications to the docstrings of `ofProfinite`Â as well.

```suggestion
/-- The product of profinite groups is a profinite group. -/
@[to_additive]
def pi {Î± : Type u} (Î² : Î± â†’ ProfiniteGrp) : ProfiniteGrp :=
  let pitype := Profinite.pi fun (a : Î±) => (Î² a).toProfinite
  letI (a : Î±): Group (Î² a).toProfinite := (Î² a).group
  letI : Group pitype := Pi.group
  letI : TopologicalGroup pitype := Pi.topologicalGroup
  ofProfinite pitype

/--The product of profinite additive groups is a profinite additive group. -/
add_decl_doc ProfiniteAddGrp.pi
```

```suggestion
/-- A FiniteGrp when given the discrete topology can be condsidered as a profinite group. -/
@[to_additive]
def ofFiniteGrp (G : FiniteGrp) : ProfiniteGrp :=
  letI : TopologicalSpace G := âŠ¥
  letI : DiscreteTopology G := âŸ¨rflâŸ©
  letI : TopologicalGroup G := {}
  of G

/-- A FiniteAddGrp when given the discrete topology can be condsidered as a profinite additive group. -/
add_decl_doc ProfiniteAddGrp.ofFiniteAddGrp
```
This docstring should say something more descriptive, along the lines of "The morphism in `FiniteGrp` associated to a homomorphism of finite groups"
fixed

```suggestion
/-- The morphism in `FiniteGrp`, induced from morphism of the category Grp. -/
```
fixed

```suggestion
/-- The morphism in `FiniteAddGrp`, induced from morphism of the category AddGrp -/
```
fixed
Probably "the category of finite groups", no?
sorry that I forgot to change this (The profinite one is correct)
fixed

```suggestion
/-- The category of finite additive groups -/
```
Have you tried using the `@to_additive` attribute?
The to_additive failed at this and profinitegrp, I don't know exactly why.
Let me try to have a look

```suggestion
  /-- An add group that is finite -/
```

```suggestion
/-- Construct a term of `FiniteGrp` from a type endowed with the structure of a finite group. -/
@[to_additive "Construct a term of `FiniteAddGrp` from a type endowed with the structure of a
  finite additive group."]
def of (G : Type u) [Group G] [Finite G] : FiniteGrp where
  toGrp := Grp.of G
  isFinite := â€¹_â€º
```
You can insert the documentation right where the `to_additive` is declared.
idem

```suggestion
import Mathlib.Algebra.Category.Grp.FiniteGrp
import Mathlib.Topology.Algebra.ContinuousMonoidHom
import Mathlib.Topology.Category.Profinite.Basic
```
We prefer to order imports alphabetically.
Type or category?
I think categoty too, thank you
The declaration is `pi` (with small `p`), no? And rather than product, I would say "a pi-type".

```suggestion
@[to_additive "Construct a term of `ProfiniteAddGrp` from a type endowed with the structure of a
compact and totally disconnected (implies Hausdorff in topological additive group)
topological additive group."]
def of (G : Type u) [Group G] [TopologicalSpace G] [TopologicalGroup G]
    [CompactSpace G] [TotallyDisconnectedSpace G] : ProfiniteGrp where
  toProfinite := .of G
  group := â€¹_â€º
  topologicalGroup := â€¹_â€º
```

```suggestion
/-- A `FiniteGrp` when given the discrete topology can be considered as a profinite group. -/
```
Not sure "product" is the right term; dependent functions, or pi-type is more appropriate.
Changed into pi-type

```suggestion
/-- The morphism in `FiniteGrp`, induced from a morphism of the category `Grp`. -/
```

```suggestion
* `ProfiniteGrp.pi` : A Pi type of profinite groups is also a profinite group.
```
Why do we need this line?
I don't know clearly, it is Yuyang Zhao who added this when refining my codes to make it compile faster. For here maybe I can delete it here.

Both in this doc and in the equivalent version for additive groups, what do you mean by "Hausdorff in topological groups"? That in the category of top. groups being compact and totally disconnected implies Hausdorff? If it is so, you can spell it more explicitely.
sorry for that, I mean totally disconnected implies {1} is closed thus Hausdorff for topological group.
Thanks!
I would also mention in this introduction that you prove that a finite group can be seen as a profinite one (pointing to the correct declaration).

pullRequest.title: [Merged by Bors] - feat(Topology/Group/Profinite): Define Profinite Groups
